{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-267-07-A |Item_parent=Disorders of acid-base equilibrium and hydro-electrolytic disorders |Item_parent_short=Disorders of acid-base balance and fluid and electrolyte disorders |Rank=A |Title=Know the main causes of respiratory acidosis |Description=None |Rubric=Etiologies |Contributors=P Rieu; B Moulin; M Flamant |Order=7}} Table 4: Aetiological diagnosis of the main respiratory acidoses {| class="wikitable" | colspan="3" | NON-PULMONARY ALVEOLARY HYPOVENTILATION |- |Type of failure |Mechanism pathophysiology |Etiologies |- | rowspan="3" |'''Ventilatory control'''' |Cerebral dysfunction |- Infections (encephalitis) - Injuries - Tumours - Stroke (Trunk) - Sedatives |- |'''Dysfunction of the centres'''' '''respiratory''' |- Loss of control - SAS central type - Hypothyroidism - Metabolic alkalosis - Sedatives - Damage to afferent and efferent pathways - Cervical spinal cord injury (> C5) - Transverse myelitis - Multiple sclerosis - Parkinson |- |Peripheral receptor dysfunction |- Bilateral carotid endarterectomy - Diabetic neuropathy
|- | rowspan="2" |'''Ventilatory pump'''' |Impaired neuromuscular function |- Anterior medullary horn - Poliomyelitis - ALS - Peripheral nerves - Guillain-Barré syndrome - Neuromuscular junction - Myasthenia - Botulism - Respiratory muscles (diaphragm) - Inflammatory myopathies and myositis - Metabolic disorders (hypokalemia, hypophosphatemia, hypermagnesemia) |- |'''Pathology''' '''de la cage thoracique''' |- Cyphoscoliosis, - Pleural fluid or gas effusion - Obesity |- |colspan="3" |PULMONARY ALVEOLARY HYPOVENTILATION |- | colspan="3" |- Severe COPD - Severe pulmonary emphysema - Parenchymal reduction (surgical resection, extensive scarring) - Inflammatory lung diseases with diaphragmatic myositis (lupus, polymyositis) |}

question.question: What is a common cause of respiratory acidosis due to ventilatory pump dysfunction?
question.option_a: Cerebral dysfunction, such as encephalitis or stroke
question.option_b: Impaired neuromuscular function, such as poliomyelitis or Guillain-Barré syndrome
question.option_c: Dysfunction of the respiratory centres, such as hypothyroidism or metabolic alkalosis
question.option_d: Pathology of the thoracic cage, such as cyphoscoliosis or pleural fluid effusion
